title: Under the sustainable sea(weeds): gimme Seaweed talks eco-friendly and organic snacks - FoodNavigator-USA.com
summary: gimmi Seaweed's rise into the plant-based category is notable for its partnerships with Korean farmers and the Korean National Federation of Fisheries to implement the production of sustainable, organic, and non-GMO seaweed. Seaweed is a regenerative crop requiring no fertilizer, pesticides, water, or land while simultaneously absorbing carbon dioxide. gimmi Seaweed products are also packaged in environmentally friendly, slimmer packaging without the standard plastic tray.
green_innovation: TRUE. gimmi Seaweed's partnerships with Korean farmers and the Korean National Federation of Fisheries to implement the production of sustainable, organic, and non-GMO seaweed is a green innovation as it contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing the use of harmful substances, promoting sustainable agriculture practices, and conserving natural resources.
business_innovation: TRUE. gimmi Seaweed's Grab & Go line is a business innovation as it is a new product that differs significantly from the firm's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE. gimme Seaweed's products are green products as they are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle. Seaweed is a regenerative crop requiring no fertilizer, pesticides, water, or land while simultaneously absorbing carbon dioxide.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific green process.
likely_naics_codes: ['311999: All Other Food Manufacturing', '311421: Frozen Fruit, Juice, and Vegetable Manufacturing', '311411: Frozen Specialty Food Manufacturing', '311919: Other Snack Food Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE. The described product or process innovation is not an example of greenwashing as it is not making false or misleading statements about the environmental benefits of the product or practice.

title: Wheat replacement: South Korea partners with local food brands to intensify rice flour NPD - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: South Korea is utilizing rice flour as a substitute for wheat flour to address supply shortages and overproduction of rice. Fifteen major local food and beverage firms are collaborating on the national ‘Rice Product Development Project’ to create 19 new rice-based products this year. The project aims to increase the utilization of powdered rice as a food ingredient and expand the consumption base of rice-based products.
green_innovation: TRUE, the project aims to address environmental sustainability goals by reducing reliance on wheat imports and utilizing surplus rice, thereby reducing waste and promoting sustainable agriculture.
business_innovation: TRUE, the project involves the development and commercialization of new rice-based products, which represent new or improved goods and services that differ significantly from previous products.
green_product: TRUE, the new rice-based products are expected to have a reduced environmental impact compared to traditional wheat-based products.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe any specific green processes.
company: South Korea Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs (MAFRA)
official_company_name: Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs

greenwashing: FALSE, the article does not provide any evidence of greenwashing practices.
